description:
Twelve-year-old Kouyama Mitsuki was devastated when she was diagnosed with a malignant tumor of the throat. She had made a promise to the boy she loves that she would one day become a singer, but her illness made singing impossible. To make matters even worse, two angels of death, Takuto and Meroko, appeared to Mitsuki and informed her that she only had one year left to live. This news provides an even greater motivation for Mitsuki to fulfill her dreams, and with a little bit of divine intervention, she begins her quest to become a professional singer so she can be reunited with Eichi before time runs out.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: Full Moon - Buscando la Luna Llena
Full Moon - Buscando a Lua Cheia
Full Moon - Procurando a Lua Cheia

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Afterlife
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the afterlife.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Musical Theater
tags.description: Features a performance that combines songs, spoken dialogue, acting, and dance.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Angels
tags.description: Prominently features spiritual beings usually represented with wings and halos and believed to be attendants of God.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Denpa
tags.description: Works that feature themes of social dissociation, delusions, and other issues like suicide, bullying, self-isolation, paranoia, and technological necessity in daily lives. Classic iconography: telephone poles, rooftops, and trains.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

title.native: 満月をさがして かわいい かわいい 大冒険

node.description:
Myco is a Japanese singer, voice actress, and radio personality. She was the vocalist for the band [Changin' My Life](https://anilist.co/staff/167173/Changin-My-Life), which was formed in 2001 and disbanded in 2003. She was the voice actor for the main character of the hit anime Full Moon o Sagashite, Mitsuki Kouyama, and the band did the music for the show.

She has released one full solo album. She was on a hiatus between 2004 and 2007.

[Website](https://ameblo.jp/sakurazuka/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/0924yakkun)

Yakkun Sakurazuka, formerly known as Yasuo Saitou (斉藤泰央), born on September 24, 1976 in Kanagawa, Japan, was a Japanese comedian and seiyuu. He made his singing debut in 2006, and has three singles out so far, "Geki Maji Mukatsuku", "1000% So Zakune", and "ChristMaster". Before he officially changed his name, he was a in comedian duo with another comedian and their skit was called "Abare Nunchaku".

He is also known as Sukeban Kyoko—a delinquent schoolgirl always seen carrying a shinai. He appears in Enta no Kami-sama, a comedian show.

Saitou died after being involved in a traffic accident on October 5, 2013, aged 37, on the Chugoku Expressway in Mine, Yamaguchi, while en route to a concert in Kumamoto Prefecture. He was hit by another car and killed when exiting his car after a slight collision.

**Doujin Circle:** Meguro Teikoku (目黒帝国, with [Meguro](https://anilist.co/staff/150816/Meguro)), Strawberry Lunch (with [Ai Minase](https://anilist.co/staff/100342/Ai-Minase))

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/arinacchi) | [Website](http://tanemuraarina.com/)

Arina Tanemura likes Japanese pop music very much (especially [Maaya Sakamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/95090/Maaya-Sakamoto), Aya Matsuura and the all-girl, [Morning Musume](https://anilist.co/staff/150336/Morning-Musume)) and she loves the game series Final Fantasy. She has one elder and one younger sister and one brother. She hates to lose (in every point of view) and she loves the Margaret Magazine of Shueisha. She says that she is too fat and that she dislikes her face. She has two cats named Riku and Kai, and at Tanemura's homepage you can find many photos of them. She wants to draw like no-one else (she can't lose...) and she loves to go to karaoke with her assistants (friends). She is good friends with the manga-ka [Ryo Maekawa](https://anilist.co/staff/98904/Ryo-Maekawa) and [Ruka Kazuki](https://anilist.co/staff/100291/Ruka-Kazuki).

She's not really a fan of yaoi (boys' love) manga, but she has made a yaoi doujinshi (no specified title) for one of her friends. She has also made a few adults-only comics on Full Moon wo Sagashite and Kamikaze Kaitou Jeanne.

Her nicknames include the sobriquets "Arinacchi" and "Arinaccho" (Arinaccho is a humorous play on Arinacchi, and was said just because of the ridiculousness of it all).

Arina participated in Shinshi Doumei Cross drama CDs as [Yoshitaka Ichinomiya](https://anilist.co/character/3507/Yoshitaka-Ichinomiya) and Postman.

**Height:** 161 cm
**Birth name:** Emi Oota (太田絵美)
**Current Stage Name:** Emi Oota (太田衣美)

Director who started off as an animator. Still animates on occasions.

Married to [Sayo Aoi](https://anilist.co/staff/118784/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomos12)

He started working at Studio Deen, where he made his debut as animator in an episode of Dai Guard. After leaving Deen he became freelance and works mainly on productions for J.C.Staff but also on some titles for Bones, Gonzo and Feel. He is particularly renowned as bishoujo animator, since he tends to pay attention to detailed character appearance and traits for girls, as well as providing his characters cute and bashful gestures.

Myco is a Japanese singer, voice actress, and radio personality. She was the vocalist for the band [Changin' My Life](https://anilist.co/staff/167173/Changin-My-Life), which was formed in 2001 and disbanded in 2003. She was the voice actor for the main character of the hit anime Full Moon o Sagashite, Mitsuki Kouyama, and the band did the music for the show.

She has released one full solo album. She was on a hiatus between 2004 and 2007.
